title: NPC Contact

properties.name: description
properties.value: NPC Contact is a magic spell that allows players to talk to various NPCs around Gielinor without having to visit them directly. It is part of the Lunar spellbook. As with all Lunar spells, the quest Lunar Diplomacy must be completed to cast this spell. When the spell is cast, an interface will open showing various NPCs the player may contact. When one is selected, the runes are spent, experience is granted, and the NPC is contacted.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:NPC Contact
NPC Contact
Released 24 July 2006 (Update)
Members Yes
Level 67
Spellbook Lunar
Type Utility
Experience 63
Runes 2 1 1
Description Speak to various NPCs
Animation
Sound Effect

NPC Contact is a magic spell that allows players to talk to various NPCs around Gielinor without having to visit them directly. It is part of the Lunar spellbook. As with all Lunar spells, the quest Lunar Diplomacy must be completed to cast this spell. When the spell is cast, an interface will open showing various NPCs the player may contact. When one is selected, the runes are spent, experience is granted, and the NPC is contacted.

Players can use a right-click option on the spell's icon in their spellbook to re-contact the NPC they last contacted through this spell.

Some of the NPCs might have additional requirements (such as quest completions) for you to contact them. They will show up as a grey outline if they can't be contacted.

Note: Using NPC Contact to contact a person you need to speak for a clue requirement does NOT advance your progress in the Treasure Trail. You must speak to the person through normal means.

Contents

  • 1 Cost
  • 2 NPCs
    • 2.1 Random NPCs
  • 3 Changes

Spell cost

NPCs[edit | edit source]

This article has an associated transcript page.
Click here for the transcript.
Chat Head Name Uses Information
Honest Jimmy Trouble Brewing Controls the Trouble Brewing minigame, and can tell you when the next game is likely to start.
Bert the Sandman Daily sand delivery Can deliver buckets of sand to your bank as long as you have completed the Hand in the Sand.
Advisor Ghrim Managing Miscellania You can collect your resources but you cannot deposit or withdraw money. You must have completed Throne of Miscellania.
Dark Mage (Abyss) Abyssal book and repairs to essence pouches Can be contacted after the completion of the Enter the Abyss miniquest. You can get him to repair your essence pouches and receive another Abyssal book from him.
Lanthus Castle Wars Is at Castle Wars and can tell you when the next game starts.
Turael Slayer Master Is one of the Slayer masters, and you can obtain tasks from him.
Spria Slayer Master Is one of the Slayer masters, and you can obtain tasks from her.
Mazchna Slayer Master Is one of the Slayer masters, and you can obtain tasks from him.
Vannaka Slayer Master Is one of the Slayer masters, and you can obtain tasks from him.
Chaeldar Slayer Master Is one of the Slayer masters, and you can obtain tasks from her.
Nieve/Steve Slayer Master Is one of the Slayer masters, and you can obtain tasks from them.
Duradel Slayer Master Is one of the Slayer masters, and you can obtain tasks from him.
Krystilia Wilderness Slayer Master Is the Wilderness Slayer master, and you can obtain tasks from her.
Konar Slayer Master Is one of the Slayer masters, and you can obtain tasks from her.
Murphy Fishing Trawler Controls the Fishing Trawler minigame, and can tell you if anyone's playing.
Cyrisus Quest Features in the Dream Mentor quest and will tell you about his adventures.
Smoggy Charcoal furnace Can be contacted to see juniper charcoal burning progress.
Captain Ginea Shayzien gang boss meetings Can be contacted to discover if any gang meetings are imminent.
Watson Clue scrolls given Can be contacted to find out which tiers of clue scroll the player has given to him.
Barbarian guard Automatic vial-smashing Can be contacted to toggle whether players automatically smash vials upon drinking the last dose of a potion.
Amy Mahogany Homes Can be contacted to receive a new construction job.

Random NPCs[edit | edit source]

Random will contact any of 26 other NPCs around Gielinor, and appears not to be "random" in that it cycles through 26 different NPCs, most of which are just amusing. The spell may start going in order randomly or just jump around. Using Random requires completion of Dream Mentor. These NPCs are:

Chat Head Name Fun Chat
Lumbridge Guide The player calls him a bad boy and makes the Lumbridge Guide admit it, but he doesn't say what he has done.
Wise Old Man The Wise Old Man will attack the player (not hurting them) and tell them to get out of his head.
My Arm The player asks how the Goutweed is, OR he tells the voice in his head to go away.
Hans The player pretends to be a brave knight coming to "kill everyone in the vicinity of Lumbridge Castle."
Evil Dave The player tells him they are Zamorak.
Clay golem The clay golem believes it has a perception mismatch, as he can hear the player but can't see them.
General Wartface The player contacts Wartface, and he gets into an argument with Bentnoze.
Drunken Dwarf He's drunk.
Al Kharid Camel The player taps directly into the camel's mind, removing language barriers.
Sandwich lady The Sandwich Lady does not want the player that contacted her to ignore her.
1337mage43 1337mage43 argues with the player over who cast the spell.
Osman The player makes fun of Osman, and he thinks he may be hallucinating from sq'irks.
Helpline Assistant A typical call to the Lunar Communication Helpline, with extremely poor customer support as usual.
Father Urhney Father Urhney believes the player is Saradomin and asks for advice, then goes off to meditate on what it means.
Romeo Romeo attempts to recite a love poem to the player.
Blurberry The player prank calls him.
Gypsy Aris Gypsy Aris can tell the future, thus knowing what the player will ask.
Ali the Sandsweeper He claims he is Ali the Sandsweeper, the best sandsweeper there is.
Man He says he's on the toilet.
Party Pete He says "party" in every sentence. He tells the player that partying is a full-time profession.
Bob the Cat He has a hairball. After Dragon Slayer II, he will not appear when players cast the spell toward a random NPC.
Captain Cain He tells the player to "Drop and give me twenty!"
Homunculus It claims that the Alchemists returned the other day, and it turned them into animals. OR Nothing useful said.
KGP Agent It thinks that the voice in its head is an intruder. OR it talks in a series of code phrases that the player doesn't understand.
Lumbridge Cow It pretends to not understand, but eventually tells the player to leave it alone.
Lumbridge Sheep It does not seem to understand. It just "baa's".

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
26 March 2020
(update | poll)

A few lines of dialogue have been removed from all Slayer masters except Konar quo Maten.

16 March 2017
(update)

Players can use a right-click option on the spell in their spellbook to instantly contact their most recently-contacted NPC.

6 January 2014
(update | poll)

Nieve and the abyssal dark mage can now be contacted by NPC Contact.

[[File:NPC Contact icon (mobile).png|left]]
'''NPC Contact''' is a [[magic]] [[spell]] that allows players to talk to various [[NPCs]] around [[Gielinor]] without having to visit them directly. It is part of the [[Lunar spellbook]]. As with all Lunar spells, the quest [[Lunar Diplomacy]] must be completed to cast this spell. When the spell is cast, an interface will open showing various NPCs the player may contact. When one is selected, the runes are spent, experience is granted, and the NPC is contacted.

Players can use a right-click option on the spell's icon in their spellbook to re-contact the NPC they last contacted through this spell.

Some of the NPCs might have additional requirements (such as quest completions) for you to contact them. They will show up as a grey outline if they can't be contacted.

'''Note:''' Using NPC Contact to contact a person you need to speak for a [[clue]] requirement does '''NOT''' advance your progress in the [[Treasure Trail]]. You must speak to the person through normal means.
